DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Recurrent Disease or Disorder Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the consent of tissue sample from recurrent disease for research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Specimen Recurrent Disease or Disorder Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the consent of recurrent disease tissue for research purposes.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: is an organ part that consists of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to specific spatial relationships; together with other tissues, it constitutes an organ component. Example(s): epithelium, muscle(tissue), connective tissue, neural tissue, lymphoid tissue.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: occurring again.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patient has consented to prov
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has consented to provide recurrence tissue (if available) samples

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to give future tissue samples (if available) at recurrence for the optional research testing

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to have the breast biopsy done if the cancer grew during therapy for research purposes.  The patient's coded samples and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has given permission to allow a small sample of the patient's tumor tissue to be taken for research purposes.  The patient's coded sample(s) and related coded information may be used to learn about, prevent, find or treat the patient's type of cancer.  This may also include research on inherited traits (genes passed on in families).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient agreed to fresh tissue sample collection and to allow samples to be kept in a Biobank for use in future research related to the GI002 study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have a biopsy to obtain and use fresh tumor tissue samples if there is a recurrence?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF  Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have three (3) biopsies to obtain fresh tumor tissue samples and to have their tumor samples used for the purposes described in the consent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to allow a sample of tumor tissue from the biopsy and related information to be kept in a Biobank for use in future research related to the BR004 study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree that their samples and related information may be kept in the NCI Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did participant agree that samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-Text-3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant agree that their samples and related information may be kept in an NCI Biobank for use in future health research?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree that an additional biopsy may be done to obtain research specimens if my disease comes back or shows signs of coming back.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have an additional biopsy done to obtain research specimens if the disease comes back or shows signs of coming back?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have an additional biopsy done to obtain research specimens if the disease comes back or shows signs of coming back and that this sample and related health information may be used for the laboratory studies described above?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have an additional biopsy done to obtain research specimens if the disease comes back or shows signs of coming back and that this sample and related health information may be used for the EAY191-N2 study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have an additional biopsy done to obtain research specimens if the disease comes back or shows signs of coming back and that this sample and related health information may be used for the EAY191-N4 study?

DataElement.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced Protocol Administration Ind-2 2018304v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
